DOC.brief_summary: This research trial study health-related symptom questionnaire measure quality life human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) -infected participant treat monitor anal lesion . Collecting information symptom patient diagnose anal lesion may help reduce risk anal cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Health-Related Symptom Questionnaires Measuring Quality Life HIV-Infected Participants Treated Monitored Anal Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To develop Anal Cancer/HSIL Outcomes Research Study ( ANCHOR ) high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion ( HSIL ) health-related quality life ( HRQoL ) Index ( HQI ) use state-of-the-art measure development methodology capture important HRQoL symptom concern person diagnose anal HSIL either treat untreated anal HSIL . OUTLINE : Participants complete ANCHOR HSIL HRQoL interview 45-60 minute , compare list symptom , concern , HRQOL impact relate HSIL diagnosis treatment . Some patient also complete cognitive interview 3 session .
DOC.criteria: HIV1 infection Biopsyproven anal HSIL within prior six month Life expectancy great 5 year History anal cancer Inability understand write consent form
